text:
Svidrigaïlov sat up in bed. 

He opened the window. 

The wind whipped his face. 

Rain splattered in from the garden below. 

“Ah, the signal!” he thought. 

“The river is overflowing.” 

He pictured the flood, the rats swimming. 

“What time is it?” 

A clock struck three. 

“Aha! It will be light soon!” 

He grinned. 

“I’ll go to the park.” 

He closed the window, lit a candle, and stood. 

“Let the rain drench me,” he whispered. 

He stepped into the night.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov contemplates the darkness and impending flood outside his window, deciding to go out into the rain.
